I support the bipartisan efforts to pass comprehensive gun safety reform and send it to the President’s desk. And I’ll continue to work to reform the filibuster so we can make the bold reforms necessary to keep our communities and our country safer.

Everyone should be able to move about their communities safely, without fear of gun violence. Parents shouldn’t need to worry when they drop their kids off at school. Failure isn’t an option on gun safety reforms. This shouldn’t be partisan—lives are at stake.

June is Gun Violence Awareness Month, something I know has been top of mind for many across the country. How could it not be? We live in a county where mass shootings are a weekly occurrence, and where active shooter drills are necessary in our kids’ classrooms.
